meanings.definition: A system of glands that secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream.
meanings.sent1: The endocrines play a vital role in regulating our body functions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the endocrines to understand how hormones affect our health.
meanings.sent3: The endocrines decided to throw a party in the bloodstream, inviting all the hormones.
meanings.sent4: Her endocrines were like diligent messengers, ensuring the hormones reached their destinations on time.
meanings.sent5: The endocrines are like tiny factories producing essential chemicals for our body.

meanings.sent1: She learned about the endocrines and their impact on mood and energy levels.
meanings.sent2: The endocrines released adrenaline in response to the stressful situation.
meanings.sent3: The endocrines decided to have a dance-off to see which hormone was the most popular.
meanings.sent4: His endocrines were like skilled chemists, carefully crafting the perfect balance of hormones.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the endocrines is crucial for maintaining a healthy hormonal balance.
